Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2008 06:53PM lenee_sd wrote: Hello everyone.  I just finished my 26th treatment.  2 regular treatments to go followed by 5 boosts for a total of 33 treatments.  The treatments had been a breeze, no real side effects other than redness ... until 5 days ago when I woke during the middle of the night with terrible chest pain.  I honestly believed I was having a heart attack. I ended up in ER and received a battery of tests (EKG, CT Scan, etc), all with good results.  The final diagnosis was pleurisy.  They sent me home with Vicadin for the pain.  That was Monday and the pain was unbearable -- it was a stabbing pain with every breath.  Each day the pain subsided and by Friday I was pain free.  When I asked my Rads Onc if the pleurisy was triggered by the radiation ... she denied it and said she hadn't run across it before.  After my online research tonight, I found a topic in the forum where others have had the same experience during radiation treatments.  Guess I'm not as unique as I was led to believe. That said ... the redness from my radiation hasn't been an issue.  Not as sore as some of the sunburns I've had in my lifetime.  My armpit is the most tender, but using the lotion helps.  I was given sample bottles of the Alra which has worked well for me. Best wishes to you all. Lenee
Posts.Title: November 2008 Rads Group HensonChi Ivy
